intro: Clerodendrum squamatum, commonly known as the silverleaf clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety silver-green foliage and clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as a shrub or small tree. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes and indoor cultivation.
